page.title: 01 General Introduction
page.content: This is the North Coast of the Isle of Thanet in the North East corner of Kent or the South East corner of Britain. Only part of four squares is land, the rest is sea. Much of the land at the top of the cliffs has been left clear of buildings so providing public access and good views for the summer visitors. Inland in the west is a great cluster of hotels and guest homes. Eastward the more recent building has been of homes so there is an interesting progression of architectural styles. The headland and lighthouse of North Foreland is further around the corner.There is a coastguard station at Foreness Point. At the same point is the crude sewage outlet pipe which is currently being renewed in an effort to keep the beaches clean.
